block.p: * Andrew Corp., Orland Park, Ill., a communications concern, signed a joint-venture agreement with the Moscow Metro subway system to develop and provide a fiber-optic telecommunications network for the Moscow metropolitan area. Moscow Metro will own 69 percent of the joint venture and Andrew 31 percent. * Associated Natural Gas Corp., Denver, an oil and gas company, entered a $34.2 million agreement with Apache Corp., Denver, an exploration company, to buy certain natural gas processing and pipline components.

* Andrew Corp., Orland Park, Ill., a communications concern, signed a joint-venture agreement with the Moscow Metro subway system to develop and provide a fiber-optic telecommunications network for the Moscow metropolitan area. Moscow Metro will own 69 percent of the joint venture and Andrew 31 percent. * Associated Natural Gas Corp., Denver, an oil and gas company, entered a $34.2 million agreement with Apache Corp., Denver, an exploration company, to buy certain natural gas processing and pipline components.

* CFM International, Evandale, Ill., an equal joint venture of Societe Nationale d'Etude et de Construction de Moteurs d'Aviation of France and General Electric Co., said it received a $400 million engine order from All Nippon Airways of Japan. * Chase Manhattan Bank, a unit a Chase Manhattan Corp., a bank holding company, will build a 53,000-square-foot operations center in Yokohama, Japan, by late 1993. * Columbia Gas System Inc., Wilmington, Del., is considering selling a liquefied natural gas subsidiary to Shell Oil Co.. * Continental Airlines, Houston, will not make a $17 million payment to its seven employee pension plans, citing objections from the company's unsecured creditors. * FMS Financial Corp., Burlington, N.J., bought the deposits of two branches of Riverside Federal Savings Bank from the Resolution Trust Corp. Terms were not disclosed. * Lockheed Sanders, Nashua, N.H., a unit of Lockheed Corp., Calabasas, Calif., received an $18 million Army contract for the Advanced Threat Infared Countermeasure system. * Mitsui & Co., Tokyo, a trade and economic development concern, will begin marketing personal computers made by Dell Computer Corp., Austin, Tex., in November. * Morrison Knudsen Corp., Boise, Idaho, a construction company, was selected to negotiate a contract worth up to $120 million to provide engineering, construction and maintenance services at NASA's Lewis Research Center near Cleveland. * Sun Co., Radnor, Pa., an energy concern, was awarded the rights to explore for oil and gas in the Gulf of Thailand by the Thai Government. * Union Carbide Corp., Danbury, Conn., plans to take in the third quarter at least $60 million of a previously announced $100 million to $150 million pretax charge.
